name: Hunger:
fact: Defines a short-term physical discomfort as a result of chronic food shortage, or in severe cases, a life-threatening lack of food.

name: Food Insecurity:
fact: Refers to limited or unreliable access to foods that are safe and nutritionally adequate

name: Malnutrition:
fact: A condition resulting from insufficient intake of biologically necessary nutrients, includes over nutrition and undernutrition

name: Gleaners
fact: Gleaners provides 284,700,000 meals anually to 21 different indiana counties to help combat community hunger

name: Prevalence:
fact: The proportion of a population affected by a disease or showing a certain characteristic

name: Food Insecurity
fact: 1 in 6 people are food insecure. 29% being veterans, 42% children, & 10% seniors

name: Gleaners 21 County Service Area
fact: There has been a 33% increase in the number of veterans and military households served in the past year

name: Glearners 21 County Service Area
fact: 31,200,000 lbs of food or 24,336,00 meals has been distributed through Gleaners

name: Glearners 21 County Service Area
fact: 592 local pantries, schools, soup kitchens and multiple community organizations work with Gleaners to help meet the needs of county residents.
